title: Hagiography
summary: A hagiography (/ˌhæɡiˈɒɡrəfi/; from Ancient Greek  ἅγιος, hagios 'holy', and  -γραφία, -graphia 'writing')[1] or vita (from Latin vita, life, which begins the title of most medieval biographies) is a biography of a saint or an ecclesiastical leader, as well as by extension, an adulatory and idealized biography of a founder, saint, monk, nun or icon in any of the world's religions.[2][3][4]
